Anoushka had fun at the Grammys

Acclaimed sitarist Anoushka Shankar, who recently presented an award at the 58th annual Grammy Awards, said she enjoyed herself backstage meeting people. “It was really fun being backstage with people I admire and getting to be a part of what many call the ‘real’ Grammys in the daytime, where a truly global and diverse group of artists are represented,” she said.

Anoushka was also nominated for an award in the Best World Music Album category for her solo album Home but lost out to Angelique Kidjo.

She praised Indo-British filmmaker Asif Kapadia for winning Best Music Film award for Amy , a documentary on the life of late singer Amy Winehouse.

“ Amy is an incredible documentary into the life of a unique artist and the trials of an addict. Recovery is something very close to my heart for personal reasons and therefore, the film impacted me greatly,” she said. — IANS
title: It was fun being backstage at Grammys: Anoushka Shankar
